documents.title: broomfield hospital midwife suspended after nipple squeeze
text: a midwife who squeezed a woman 's nipples while she was in labour and told her to imagine she was smoking a spliff has been suspended .
at broomfield hospital in chelmsford , midwife samantha stanton asked the woman : `` what do you expect ?
you 're in labour , you should be in pain . ''
a nursing and midwifery council ( nmc ) panel found she acted unprofessionally towards the woman in june 2014 .
ms stanton was suspended for 12 months , as reported by the essex chronicle .

documents.title: greater anglia spends £ 40m improving service
text: greater anglia has published its annual report today and says it has to do more to meet customers ' expectations .
last year , the rail operator came 20th out of 22 companies in a survey of customer satisfaction .
it says it has spent £ 40m to improve experiences for commuters , including refurbishing trains and adding thousands of extra seats .

documents.title: 'are you going to make a five-a-side team ? ' four braintree town players leave in 24 hours
text: four braintree town players have left the club in the space of 24 hours , prompting some social media users to question whether the team was going to play five-a-side instead .
mark phillips , daniel sparkes , sam habergham and alex woodyard are the latest names to leave the iron .

documents.title: southminster couple guilty in term time holiday case
text: i 'm at chelmsford magistrates ' court where a couple who took their children on an 11-day holiday during term time have been found guilty of failing to make sure their children regularly attend school .
ben and rebecca walker , of southminster , took their two daughters on holiday to tenerife in october 2015 .
their decision meant the children had 22 unauthorised absences from latchingdon primary school .
the pair were found guilty and a 12-month conditional discharge was imposed .
they were also told they had to pay the initial £ 240 fine given to them by essex county council for failing to make sure their daughters , aged 10 and six , attended school regularly .
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: breakingparents get conditional discharge for taking children on holiday during term time

more details to follow .

documents.title: is the end of 'heat-related ' delays on trains nigh ?
text: leaves on the line , staff not turning up , or signalling problems .
if you 're a commuter , these words probably send shivers down your spine - but now there 's light at the end of the tunnel for `` heat-related '' delays .

network rail is replacing 320km ( 199 miles ) of overhead lines connecting essex , suffolk and norwich with london liverpool street , so during hot weather lines wo n't sag and cause delays for passengers .
the work , however , is not due to be completed until 2019 .

documents.title: drone used in search for sylvia stuart in weybread
text: police say they 've deployed a drone to help search the weybread area as they continue to try and find sylvia stuart , who was reported missing on 3 june .

as part of the investigation into mrs stuart 's disappearance , and the murder of her husband peter , police are also continuing their hunt for ali qazimaj , 42 , who had been living in the tilbury area of essex and is believed to have travelled to france .
det ch supt simon parkes ( during an earlier interview ) said : `` over the weekend police have been continuing searches and these will be ongoing in a bid to locate sylvia .
`` a lot of work is continuing behind the scenes , including liaison with authorities on the continent to try to locate ali qazimaj . ''
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: not the first time this year southend hospital has declared an 'internal critical incident '
text: it 's not the first time southend hospital has run out of beds and struggled to cope this year .
in january , we reported three occasions that the hospital declared an `` internal critical incident '' .

documents.title: poster threatening dog walkers of poison traps handed to police , reports echo
text: a poster warning that dog food laced with poison has been put down in leigh to teach `` selfish '' owners a lessons has been handed to police , the echo reports .
the flyer , which is said to have been pinned to a lamppost on marine parade , warned : `` the recent level of mess on the path has become intolerable .
due to selfish dog owners , dog food laced with poison will be placed in this area of path and woods . ''
the man who found the poster told the paper the person responsible was a `` sick individual '' .

documents.title: 'think very carefully ' about using southend a & e , bosses warn
text: southend hospital bosses are urging members of the public to `` think very carefully '' about using its a & e .
however , those experiencing choking , chest pain , blacking out , blood loss and fractures `` should not hesitate '' to visit , they say .
we 'll keep you updated with information throughout the day as we get it .

documents.title: 'we have no beds available at the hospital '
text: the chief operating officer of southend hospital says there are `` no beds available '' at the hospital .

we are working closely with our partners at the clinical commissioning groups and local authorities to allow us to safely discharge patients who are medically fit so that we can free up beds for new admissions . ''

documents.title: what is an 'internal critical incident ' ?
text: a `` internal critical incident '' means southend hospital is currently so full it is losing its ability to deliver services and needs specials measures and support from other agencies to restore normal operating functions .
the hospital says it has seen an increase in the number of patients while already operating at full capacity .
it also remains on a `` black alert '' , which indicates the hospital has run out of bed space .

documents.title: breakingsouthend hospital declares 'internal critical incident '
text: southend hospital has just declared an `` internal critical incident '' after a `` very high number '' of patients arrived at its a & e , with the hospital already operating at full capacity .
more to follow .

documents.title: cyclist dies after crashing with van in weeley
text: some news just in from essex police .
a cyclist has died after he crashed with a white van in weeley yesterday afternoon .
it happened on the southbound carriageway of the a133 at about 18:00 .
the cyclist , a man in his 40s and from clacton , suffered serious head injuries and later died in hospital .

documents.title: ugh weather warning issued
text: just when you thought the storms had passed and we could get on with enjoying the summer , the met office has issued a `` yellow '' warning of heavy rain for the region for today , tomorrow and wednesday .
it says there 's a risk 15-25mm of rain could fall within an hour in scattered locations , bringing the risk of flooding , especially if it falls in urban areas .
lovely .

documents.title: essex tie cup thriller against somerset
text: former captain james foster made an unbeaten 75 off 50 deliveries as essex earned a thrilling tie off the final ball against somerset at chelmsford yesterday .
adam hose ( 77 ) and jim allenby ( 68 ) shared a stand of 141 as somerset totalled 179-8 in a game reduced to 29 overs each after rain interruption .
essex were set a revised target of 177 to win , but slumped to 83-7 .
the home side needed 16 off the last over but foster hit a six , then ran a bye off the final ball to earn the tie .

documents.title: essex school introduces 'gender neutral ' uniform which allows boys to wear skirts
text: what do you make of this next story then ?
a school in maldon has become the first in essex to introduce a `` gender neutral '' uniform - which means boys are allowed to wear skirts and girls can wear trousers if they choose to do so .
maldon primary is one of eight state schools across the country to relax clothing stereotypes .
we 're currently trying to contact the school to hear how it has gone down with parents , but we 'd love to know if you think it 's a good idea .

documents.title: football violence in essex ?
text: the violence in marseille over the weekend comes as bbc essex learned there were 27 arrests for bad behaviour at football games in the county during the 2014-15 season .
the majority of arrests were for violent disorder , but some were related to alcohol and one was for a pitch incursion .
seven people are currently banned from attending football matches .
the man in charge of football liaison at essex police is ch insp richard phillibrown .
he said : `` any offence that occurs in a football ground goes to court and people will come away with a banning order . ''

documents.title: essex football fan in marseille describes 'worst violence '
text: we 've managed to catch up with david hancock from southend who was in marseille over the weekend for england 's first euro 2016 match against russia .
the 1-1 result was n't the only thing making the headlines - no doubt you 've seen of the violence that erupted towards the end of saturday 's game .
david said : `` i 've been all over the world to watch football , and this is the worst [ violence ] i 've seen . ''
at about 01:00 on sunday morning , our driver was trapped in the side streets it was dark , the police were wielding truncheons and people were smashing windows .
we were very lucky to get out . ''

text: some described it on twitter as `` the end of the world '' and it certainly felt like it at times as essex was rocked under a storm .

after a while the storm passed , and an amazing skyscape was uncovered .
